page.title: 13POCKET MONEY SURVEY.
page.content: A survey was conducted in the Second Year to find the average amount of pocket money that children were given today. 100 children were questioned and the average figure was Â£2 per child. Many pupils had other ways of earning money,for example, babysitting or having a paper round,therefore, most children had much more than this amount to spend each week. All pupils questioned believed they were expected to do less work around the home than in their parents day. Most pupils believed this was due to more labour-saving devices in the home.
